title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 56-6.2 - Number and location of background air samples
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 56-6.2 - Number and location of background air samples

State Regulations
(a) Phase I B background sampling--large
asbestos project. Prior to asbestos abatement contractor mobilization and
starting Phase II A, a minimum of five samples shall be taken inside the
intended regulated abatement work area, and a minimum of five samples shall be
taken outside of the intended regulated abatement work area within the building
or structure in uncontaminated areas that are within 10 feet of the anticipated
locations of isolation or critical barriers. If the entire building/structure
is the intended regulated abatement work area, the five air samples outside the
regulated abatement work area shall be eliminated, and a minimum of one
background ambient air sample shall be taken outside of the building or
structure, as close as possible to the area where abatement work is to be
conducted. See Table 2 in section
56-4.9
of this Part. (b) Phase I B background sampling--small
asbestos project. Prior to asbestos abatement contractor mobilization and
starting Phase II A, a minimum of three samples shall be taken inside the
intended regulated abatement work area and three samples shall be taken outside
of the intended regulated abatement work area within the building or structure
in uncontaminated areas that are within 10 feet of the anticipated locations of
isolation or critical barriers. If the entire building/structure is the
intended regulated abatement work area, the three air samples outside the
regulated abatement work area shall be eliminated, and a minimum of one
background ambient air sample shall be taken outside of the building or
structure, as close as possible to the area where abatement work is to be
conducted. See Table 2 in section
56-4.9
of this Part. (c) Phase I B background sampling--minor
asbestos project. Not required. Notes
